kindred.view.cli

Enum Colour

  • Object
    • Enum<Colour>
      • kindred.view.cli.Colour
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Colour>

     enum Colour
extends Enum<Colour>
    Represents one of the possible colours in the terminal using ANSI escape sequences.
    Author:
    Kindred Team
    See Also:
    ANSI Escape Sequences: Colours and Cursor Movement

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getValueAsBackground()
      Gives the number that can be used in an ANSI escape sequence to use the colour as background.
      String getValueAsForeground()
      Gives the number that can be used in an ANSI escape sequence to use the colour as foreground.
      static Colour randomBackgroundColour()
      Creates a random colour that can serve as the background of an Atom.
      static Colour randomForegroundColour()
      Creates a random colour that can serve as the foreground of an Atom.

      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static Colour[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • RESET

        public static final Colour RESET
        Resets the colours.

      • BLACK

        public static final Colour BLACK
        Black colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • RED

        public static final Colour RED
        Red colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • GREEN

        public static final Colour GREEN
        Green colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • BROWN

        Brown colour. Available to both background and foreground.

        Blue colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • PURPLE

        public static final Colour PURPLE
        Purple colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • CYAN

        public static final Colour CYAN
        Cyan colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • LIGHT_GREY

        public static final Colour LIGHT_GREY
        Light grey colour. Available to both background and foreground.

      • DARK_GREY

        public static final Colour DARK_GREY
        Dark grey colour. Available only to foreground.

      • LIGHT_RED

        public static final Colour LIGHT_RED
        Light red colour. Available only to foreground.

      • LIGHT_GREEN

        public static final Colour LIGHT_GREEN
        Light green colour. Available only to foreground.

      • YELLOW

        public static final Colour YELLOW
        Yellow colour. Available only to foreground.

      • LIGHT_BLUE

        public static final Colour LIGHT_BLUE
        Light blue colour. Available only to foreground.

      • LIGHT_PURPLE

        public static final Colour LIGHT_PURPLE
        Light purple colour. Available only to foreground.

      • LIGHT_CYAN

        public static final Colour LIGHT_CYAN
        Light cyan colour. Available only to foreground.

      • WHITE

        public static final Colour WHITE
        White colour. Available only to foreground.

    • Field Detail

      • value

        private final String value
        The inner part of the ANSI escape sequence of this colour.

      • VALUES

        private static final Colour[] VALUES
        Contains the corresponding enum value of each possible ClientToServerMessage type. Stored in a static variable to save time from calling values() many times.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static Colour[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Colour c : Colour.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static Colour valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • randomForegroundColour

        public static Colour randomForegroundColour()
        Creates a random colour that can serve as the foreground of an Atom. Does not generate RESET.
        Returns:
        a random colour that can be used as foreground

      • randomBackgroundColour

        public static Colour randomBackgroundColour()
        Creates a random colour that can serve as the background of an Atom. Does not generate RESET.
        Returns:
        a random colour that can be used as background

      • getValueAsForeground

        public String getValueAsForeground()
        Gives the number that can be used in an ANSI escape sequence to use the colour as foreground.
        Returns:
        the inner part of the ANSI escape sequence of this colour to be used as foreground

      • getValueAsBackground

        public String getValueAsBackground()
        Gives the number that can be used in an ANSI escape sequence to use the colour as background.
        Returns:
        the inner part of the ANSI escape sequence of this colour to be used as background
